Description[edit | edit source]

The Mirage F1CT is a rank VII French jet fighter with a battle rating of 11.0 (AB/SB) and 11.3 (RB). It was introduced in Update "Danger Zone".

General info[edit | edit source]

Armaments[edit | edit source]

Ballistic Computer
CCIP (Guns) CCIP (Rockets) CCIP (Bombs) CCRP (Bombs)

Offensive armament[edit | edit source]

Main article: DEFA 553 (30 mm)

The Mirage F1CT is armed with:

  • A choice between two presets:
    • 1 x 30 mm DEFA 553 cannon, belly-mounted (135 rpg)
    • 1 x 30 mm DEFA 553 cannon + 120 x countermeasures

Suspended armament[edit | edit source]

Main articles: SAMP Type 25 (250 kg), SAMP Mk 82 (250 kg), SAMP Type 21 (400 kg), SAMP Mk 83 (500 kg), SAMP Mk 84 (1,000 kg)
Main articles: Matra R530, Matra R530E, Matra R550 Magic 2, Matra Super 530F, SNEB type 23

The Mirage F1CT can be outfitted with the following ordnance presets:

  • Without load
  • 72 x SNEB type 23 rockets
  • 144 x SNEB type 23 rockets
  • 10 x 250 kg SAMP Mk 82 bombs (2,500 kg total)
  • 8 x 400 kg SAMP Type 21 bombs (3,200 kg total)
  • 6 x 500 kg SAMP Mk 83 bombs (3,000 kg total)
  • 3 x 1,000 kg SAMP Mk 84 bombs (3,000 kg total)
  • 2 x Matra R550 Magic 2 missiles
  • 2 x Matra R530E missiles
  • 2 x Matra R530 missiles
  • 2 x Matra Super 530F missiles

Usage in battles[edit | edit source]

Describe the tactics of playing in the aircraft, the features of using aircraft in a team and advice on tactics. Refrain from creating a "guide" - do not impose a single point of view, but instead, give the reader food for thought. Examine the most dangerous enemies and give recommendations on fighting them. If necessary, note the specifics of the game in different modes (AB, RB, SB).

Pros and cons[edit | edit source]

Pros:

  • Stock Magic 2 missiles
  • Super 530F missiles
  • Great manoeuvrability
  • 120 x countermeasures

Cons:

  • Only one DEFA 553 cannon

History[edit | edit source]

Describe the history of the creation and combat usage of the aircraft in more detail than in the introduction. If the historical reference turns out to be too long, take it to a separate article, taking a link to the article about the vehicle and adding a block "/History" (example: https://wiki.warthunder.com/(Vehicle-name)/History) and add a link to it here using the main template. Be sure to reference text and sources by using <ref></ref>, as well as adding them at the end of the article with <references />. This section may also include the vehicle's dev blog entry (if applicable) and the in-game encyclopedia description (under === In-game description ===, also if applicable).

Media[edit | edit source]

Excellent additions to the article would be video guides, screenshots from the game, and photos.
